manual.examplemod.title: Turret Field Manual
manual.examplemod.empty: No chapter found. Try another keyword.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_start.summ: First goals after entering a new world.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_start.body: This mod gives you combat skeleton allies and control tools. Start by placing your first turret with the wand, then switch it between follow and guard modes based on terrain. The terminal is your central control block for squad status and recall.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_start.usag: Build shelter first. Summon 1-2 skeletons, test movement in open area, then move into caves once follow behavior is stable.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_start.faq: Q: I lost the manual. A: Rejoin the world and the server will re-check and issue one if none exists.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_controls.s: How to command your skeleton squad quickly.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_controls.b: Most interactions are right click based: use the wand on blocks to deploy turrets, interact with turrets for mode and equipment management, and open the terminal to batch-control the squad.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_controls.u: Keep command items in hotbar slots 1-3 so you can switch between mining, fighting, and recall quickly.
manual.examplemod.entry.basic_controls.f: Q: Why does command response feel delayed? A: In heavy combat, AI updates and pathfinding can queue. Wait one tick cycle and retry.
Best for travel and active combat.
In follow mode, skeletons prioritize staying near the owner. They can reposition and use mobility logic to keep pace and reduce distance.
Use follow mode while exploring surface or changing biomes. Keep guard mode for fixed defense points.
Q: They do not teleport every time. A: Teleport requires a teleport module and cooldown readiness.
manual.examplemod.entry.skeleton_guard.b: Guard mode keeps units in place and prevents unnecessary crowding around the player. It is ideal for base defense, choke points, and safe mining corridors.
manual.examplemod.entry.skeleton_guard.u: Before mining in tight tunnels, switch nearby units to guard mode to avoid blocking your path.
manual.examplemod.entry.skeleton_guard.f: Q: Can guard units still attack? A: Yes, they still engage hostile targets in range.
manual.examplemod.entry.skeleton_captain: Captain is evaluated on a timed cycle.
Captain evaluation now runs on a fixed 60-second cycle. During the interval, captain does not change even if member state fluctuates. This removes frequent visual and logic jitter.
If you promote a stronger member via upgrades, wait until the next evaluation tick for captain transfer.
Q: Why no instant captain change? A: The design intentionally avoids unstable rapid switching.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_wand.title: Doom Turret Wand
manual.examplemod.entry.item_wand.body: Craft: shaped recipe (top rotten flesh, middle obsidian, bottom iron block). Obtain: crafting, creative tab, and starter kit grant. Upgrade: this item itself has no level upgrade; progression is done by upgrading the summoned unit and modules.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_wand.usage: Use case: right-click block face to deploy a skeleton unit bound to you.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_wand.faq: Q: Why deployment failed? A: Spawn position may be blocked or invalid for entity placement.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_glitch_chip: Craft: currently no public crafting recipe. Obtain: creative tab and turret print/recycle flow drop. Upgrade: no direct level upgrade, but usage has quality tiers: consume diamond for guaranteed recovery or iron ingot for chance-based recovery.
Use case: right-click with required material in inventory to attempt data recovery and reconstruct a turret wand.
Q: Why cannot use it? A: You need at least one diamond or iron ingot in inventory.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_terminal.bo: Craft: shaped recipe with row2 redstone torch + glowstone + redstone torch, row3 center redstone block. Obtain: crafting and creative tab. Upgrade: terminal block itself has no level, but it controls upgraded units and modules.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_terminal.us: Use case: place and right-click to open list, inspect status, recall, rename, and team management.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_terminal.fa: Q: Why is recall disabled? A: The target unit lacks teleport module or teleport condition is not met.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_tp_module.b: Craft: shaped recipe (top lapis block, middle ender pearl, bottom redstone block). Obtain: crafting and creative tab. Upgrade: module supports level scaling (Lv1-Lv5) and is upgraded through an anvil; higher levels improve behavior defined by module rules.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_tp_module.u: Use case: install into turret module slots to enable teleport-related logic.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_tp_module.f: Q: No teleport happened? A: Check module installed state, cooldown, and safe destination.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_multishot_m: Craft: shaped recipe (top amethyst shard, middle bow, bottom string). Obtain: crafting and creative tab. Upgrade: module supports level scaling (Lv1-Lv5) and is upgraded through an anvil; higher level increases volley output and scaling rules.
Use case: install for crowd fights and multi-target suppression.
Q: Does it replace teleport module? A: No, they cover different tactical roles.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_core_module: Craft: this is a documentation extension recipe card used as the fifth 3x3 example in the manual UI. It is not registered in the default datapack.
Use case: visual template for future module-combination crafting expansion.
Q: Why cannot I craft it in survival? A: This one is intentionally manual-only example content.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_death_plaqu: Craft: no crafting recipe. Obtain: guaranteed drop when a turret dies. Upgrade: no item level upgrade; data quality depends on recorded turret state at death.
Use case: right-click placement position to restore a recorded unit from the plaque.
Q: Why some runtime states are missing? A: volatile combat states are intentionally excluded.
manual.examplemod.entry.item_player_manu: Craft: shaped recipe with center slot any wooden planks and right slot cobblestone. Obtain: craft, auto-granted on first login if missing, also available in creative. Upgrade: version-synced on login; when manual schema updates, your existing book is upgraded automatically.
Use case: right-click to open categorized guide with search and bookmark features.
Q: How to sync latest manual content? A: relog the world/server to trigger version check.
manual.examplemod.entry.upgrade_module_p: Both Teleport and Multi-Shot modules follow the same anvil loop: module + tier material + anvil operation to reach the next level.
Use case: prepare target module in inventory, then apply tier material according to the level chain.
Q: Why no level-up result? A: Check target module level, required tier material, and anvil state.
manual.examplemod.entry.upgrade_quick_co: Icon cards for common upgrade-related commands.
This page visualizes command examples used during debugging and operations, including module grant and plaque teleport.
Use case: run command in server/operator context and verify target permissions before execution.
Q: Why command rejected? A: Usually insufficient permission level or invalid coordinates/arguments.
manual.examplemod.ui.collapsed_hint: Details collapsed. Click Expand in the top-right corner to view text.
manual.examplemod.ui.no_crafting_recipe: - No 3x3 crafting recipe for this entry.
manual.examplemod.ui.example_recipe_noti: This entry is a manual-only expansion example. It is not registered in the default datapack.
For 1-2 block tunnels, set nearby units to guard mode or keep distance. Follow AI now includes mining-avoid behavior to reduce collision while you are actively digging.
When branch mining, keep one guard behind and one support unit in follow mode at distance.
Q: Still blocked sometimes? A: Pause briefly after direction changes to allow path recalculation.
manual.examplemod.entry.advanced_trouble: If behavior is unexpected, check owner binding, mode state, module installation, cooldown, and world chunk loading first. Most command issues are caused by one of these states.
Use terminal list and unit IDs to inspect exact member state before changing configs.
Q: Can this manual expand in future versions? A: Yes, chapter providers are extensible for incremental updates.
tooltip.examplemod.teleport_module.title: Teleport Module +II
tooltip.examplemod.teleport_module.desc: Provides tactical teleport and cooldown control.
tooltip.examplemod.death_record.use_on_g: Right-click ground to summon and restore the recorded turret.
gui.examplemod.mode_follow_tooltip: Current: Follow Mode. Click to switch to Guard Mode.
gui.examplemod.mode_guard_tooltip: Current: Guard Mode. Click to switch to Follow Mode.
